definition.text: A task manager is a device used to organize and control any number of tasks, which, in turn, control bot instances. You use a task manager to start or stop several tasks at the same time.

paragraphs.text: Task managers are used both in the context of data mining and trading operations, to facilitate the organization of tasks.
For example, you may set up a task manager to handle tasks related to a particular set of indicators used with a certain strategy. Or, for example, to organize multiple backtesting sessions.
The key aspect of a task manager is that it allows starting and stopping all tasks at once.
